ssh.name: OpenSSH User Enumeration
ssh.description: Allows remote attackers to enumerate valid users.
ssh.solution: Upgrade to a patched version of OpenSSH.

http.name: Apache Path Traversal
http.description: Improper validation allows attackers to map URLs to files outside the document root.
http.solution: Upgrade Apache to version 2.4.50 or later.

https.name: Heartbleed
https.description: Allows reading sensitive memory contents in TLS.
https.solution: Upgrade OpenSSL to version 1.0.1g or later.

ftp.name: VSFTPD Backdoor
ftp.description: A backdoor in VSFTPD allows remote command execution.
ftp.solution: Upgrade to a secure version of VSFTPD.

smtp.name: Postfix Spoofing Vulnerability
smtp.description: Allows sending spoofed emails via Postfix.
smtp.solution: Apply security patches from the vendor.

mysql.name: MySQL Unauthorized Access
mysql.description: A flaw in authentication allows unauthorized access.
mysql.solution: Upgrade MySQL to the latest version.

postgresql.name: PostgreSQL Memory Corruption
postgresql.description: A vulnerability can cause memory corruption.
postgresql.solution: Update PostgreSQL to the latest version.

rdp.name: BlueKeep (RDP Remote Code Execution)
rdp.description: Allows unauthenticated attackers to execute code remotely.

dns.name: DNS Cache Poisoning
dns.solution: Use DNSSEC and apply software patches.

smb.name: SMBGhost (Windows SMBv3)
smb.description: A flaw in SMBv3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
smb.solution: Disable SMBv3 compression and apply patches.
